sentence: In my point of view , I agree with parents should let children make mistakes and let them from their own mistakes .
First of all , I think we are all different person.
One words cannot talked with everyone .
Long times ago,a mother had a children.
The children named Jack,he was very fleshless.
And his good friend named Tom was tarnal fat.
When they played together,Jack's mom usually told him to ate more foods.
Tom's mom looked at this ,also told to Tom that he should ate more than Jack.
Ten years ago,Tom was weight for 110KG .
Becasuse his obesity,he was dead.
Jack was very thin,so his mother told him to ate more to add some nutrition.
But Jack was very fat ,he can't ate more .
This is the differences from their two persons.
All of people like this.
So,parents should let children make mistakes and let them learn from their own mistakes.
Secondly, If you think about your children cannot get mistakes ,you are wrong.
Failure is the mother of success.
If your children make mistakes,it was normally.
Washington,the leader of USA.
When he was young,he cutted down a tree which belong to his father.
He was very nervous that time.
After that day,he had never get a good rest.
Finally,he told hs father that he cutted down the tree.
His father never hitted him,bug give him a large hug.
And said:"Oh, my boy!
You can find out your mistake and told to me.

I love you."

So,I think parents should et children make mistakes and let them lrarn from their own mistakes.

Recently the issue of weather parents off their children mony for each high grade they get in school has brought into foucus on public attention, different people hold different views, some people take it for granted that.
However, other people think parent shouldn't give a lot of money to child.
For me, I don't think it's a good idea.
First of all, with the rapid development of socity, people's idea have changed.
People treat enducation much more important, some parents create some new methods encourage their children to be enthusiastic about learning.
So many parents offer money to their children.
But I think that will changed children's thinking for money, and they will think only money is purpose to study.
For example, my aunt always give a lot of money to her son, which is hoped her child will get good results in every exam.
But on one occasion, his son didn't do well in the exam, so my aunt don't give money to her son.
Then my aunt had a conflict with her son.
Later, as long as my aunt didn't give her son money, her son wouldn't study hard.
The second reason is that school-age children are young, they don't have the ability to control themselves and to tell things right and wrong.
If they have many money, they mightl use this money to buy some novel that indendent of learning or they might to use this money to play computer games.
That isn't bebefit for their study, and make kids addicted to the internet.
If children are addicted to the internet, they will don't like study.
Admittedly, monye could encourage children to get hidgt grade in some way, but with the long time, the child my develop a bad habit that is lavish money.
So  I think parent should give a lot of money to their children.
All in all, I think parent should give a lot of money to their children.
because that will changed children's thinking for money, and they will think only money is purpose to study and effect children's study.

Their life quality will depend on it.
There is no doubt that money will encourage children to study hard and get high grade.
But as far as I am concerned,it's not beneficial to give children money for each high grade they get in school.
The followings are my reasons.

It's likely for them to use money in a wrong way.
For example,many children will use money to buy their equipment in the computer games.
As time goes by,they will be more addicted in playing computer games and they won't spend too much time on their study.

With the improvement of society, modern people become creative so that people's dream become variety.
A controverstial topic arouses a debate: whether people should follow the ambitious dream or focus on achieving realistc goals.
Some people think realistic goals is more practical.
however I hold the view that people should chase the ambitious dream.
My view can be illustrated as follows.
First, ambitious dream will motivate people work hard and keep going.
With the ambitious dream, people can easily see the distance between the reality and the dream so that they will work hard  to shorten the distance.
Even if the ambitious dream dream is hard to come true, it will encourage people keep doing to achieve it.
But the realistic goals are less hard than ambitious dream, it can not stimulate people foucs the goal for a long term.
For example, Ma Yun, the CEO of Alibaba, wants to no hard business in the world.
With this dream, he keep working above 20 years, he work about 14 hours per day.
Eventually, his conpany linked large number of product makers and sellers.
Second, ambitious dream will bring people creative insights.
People will not be limited in the short-term goals, they can expect the unlimited possibility of future and make preparation.
If people just want to achieve the realistic goal, they have less chance to prepare for future.
For example, my uncle wants to change the unconvenient traffic method in ten years ago.
Later, with this dream, he know much about the mobile internet and become a programer when he enter the university, and his dream motivate him join in the Uber which supply taxi service for people.
In conclusion, people should chasing the ambitious dream rather than the realistic goals.
Not only because people will work hard and keep going
Nowadays, with the competations in the society gradually increase, children are forced by their parents to learn as much  skills and knowledge as possible and thus under great pressure.
Some people consider that students should more time on doing homework or participating in orgazed activities related to school or sports instead of doing something they really interested in.
Personally speaking, I firmly disagree with the idea and my viewpoint is based on the following reasons and examples.
First, studying all day long without any entertainment may reduce the efficiency of study.
Just as the old saying goes, all work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
There is no doubt that studying hard is beneficial for students.
However, if they cannot relax during heavy work, it is possible that even it seems that they are learing, they cannot concentrate on what they are reading and actually learn nothing.
Take my classmate in high school as an example.
His family was poor so he tried his best to work hard.
I could always see him with a book, even when he was walking.
In spite of all the hard work, his grades were poor and did not pass the college entrance exam.
In addition, participating in activites that children are really interested in can provide students with another way to success.
In the future, students may be cannot find a job related to their major and their interests will give them a second chance to find a decent job.
For example, my uncle, who majored in math in university, lost his job last year and could not find a new job.
Nevertheless, he loving running when he was a child and practiced much.
As a consequence, he found a job to teach children about who to run in a primary school.
Admmittedly, spending more time on homework or organized activities is useful to students' study.
With more time to learn
At present, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debete among students: will people spend less time cooking and preparing food in twenty years than they do today.
Answers vary one from another.
Some people claim that people will spend more time on the preparation of the food and meal for people gradually increase their awareness of the value of  life quality.
Contrary to their opnions comes to my own perspective that the time spent in cooking and preparing foods will decrease in twenty years.
My viewpoint is based on the following points.
First, more advanced technology will appear and replace human work to cook, which will shorten the time human spends on cooking.
To be more specific, with the twenty-year development of technology, it is more likely that people can invent some new machines to help them cook.
And as we know, the efficiency of machines is usually faster than human work, which will largely shorten the time people stay in the kitchen.
For example, as I know, there is a kind of mechine used in the kitchen nowadays.
what people only need to do to this machine is to pour the ingredients into the container of the machine and then click some bottoms and the machine will work automatically.
It could fry, stir, steam and so on.
Finnally, people will attain delicious dishes from this machine.
That's the technology appearing nowadays.
So we can predict that there must be more advanced machine coming out in the future and the time human spend in the kitchen will decrease furthur.
Second, people will spend more time on their work rather than cooking for the life pace is faster and faster.
Specifically, with the development of the society, to follow the step of the society people are facing much more pressure from life and work than before.
Under this circumstance, people will reduce time spent on other less important things than their work such as time spent on road, cooking, eating and even sleeping.
For example, my uncle work in Beijing and face a serious situation that he must work so hard that he could survive in this city which is well-known for its fast life pace.
So he usually hust eats bread for lunch and dinner to shorten the time of the "unnecessary things".
As we imagine, people in 2018 have faced so much pressure.
What if people in 2038 faced the same situation?
They certainly spen
In conclusion, people will spend less time cooking and preparing foods in twenty years than they do mowadays.
I do agree with the statement,because we all know that making mistakes are something unavoiable during the development of a child.
And learning the results or the solutions of a mistake is significant to a child's behavior.
Just take an example,once a child is putting a glass bottle at the edge of the table where would be easily for it to drop,we don't need to call the kid back to put it again.

If the glass bottle is accidently hitted by the kid's arm,it break into pieces in the kid's sight(just be cautions in case that the child get hurt if he picks them up),then he will know the consequence of what he did before.
The reason why we don't need to stop children is also include that the different types of memory lasts differently in time.
Assume that we stop children,what they learn is just the words'you can't do this'or something else which will not become solid in their mind,and as a result,we need to tell them once and once again.
But what if we let them know themselves in the visual perspective?

they will become a unforgettable thing in their memory,because we all know that we can memorize the pictures more rapidly then words and it will lasts longer,too,as we will better memorize a poem if we can form a series of pictures of the poem.
A good saying goes that:'Great works are from failures'.
In a word,we are ought to make children follow their stages of development which they need to correct the behaviors,learn the forbidden actions and to fit in the society.
Like I said at the beginning,children's making mistakes is common and natural,we should not interrupt it.
I think it is a good idea.
In fact,in China,school-age children usually don't have enough time and ability to make money for themselves.
They have to study even in their vacation.
They can't stop learning because the pressure of social competition.
All of them try their best just because they don't want left behind by others.
Otherwise,their parents don't allow their children being left behind and don't need their children pay for tuition.
So,it's a good idea in China.
But,as the development of society,people's thought are changing.
More and more parents regard as important on their children's comprehensive abilities.
Nowadays, many parents tend to award their school-age children money for their high grade, and most students are willing to receive these extra money from theri parents.
Although it is understandably for parents to get well-proformed children rewerded, I consider it not a good idea.
Firstly, children, lack of the ability of self-controlling, may cheat in the examation in order to get the money instead of working.
Obviously, parents intend to encourage their children to work hard and get high grade in school, but from students' aspect, what they really concern is grade.
Once they find that they can gain high mark by chatting rather than hardworking, it not hard to imagine which way they choose.
For example, my father promised to buy me a toy car if I aced in the final test of grade 2.
In order to fulfilled my dream of owning a toy car, I tried my best in perparing for the test.
Not confident as I was, I finally deceided to wrote the point on a tiny paper instead of remembering it.
That was excatly cheating but I did not realize at that age.
Secondly, if students get used to receive money from parents, the money itself may gradually become the motivation of their study, which makes it hard for them to realize the importance of study.
And once they grow up, they may find themselves are less enthusiastic in study, which is vital in this demanding soecity.
For instance, it is not rare to find a lot of students are satisified with what they learn in university class.
Never getting access to library to search some knowledge is widely accepted by them.
This phenomenon indicates that students show less passion on self-stduy.
From my perspective, parents award with them money instead of letting them know the importance is account for these phenomena.
All listed above come together to show my view point that awarding them money

Recently, and interesting question has aroused a heated debate among people: it is better for people to follow their dreams even if the dreams are ambitious than focus on achieving realistic goals.
Answers vary from person to person.
Some claim that people should follow their own dream even if it is so ambitious.
However, I stand on the opposite site and I firmly believe that it is good for people to focus on achieving realistic goals.
Some reasons and examples given below can illustrate my point of view.
First, the realistic goal is more easy to achieve.
As we all know, every one have their own dream and want to achieve it.
What makes dream easy to achieve is the clear project and the available goal.
Which means they need to make the dream become a realistic goal and do some project to achieve it.
On the contrary, if the people just have a big dream without any available way to get the dream, it is just a imagination and the people would never achieve it.
For example, I want to finish a 10 miles marathon after 3 month.
So I make some plan to help me achieve it-- training my running ability every morning that running 3 miles near the Hou lake. l follow my project and finish every day training work.
Finally I run the marathon and won a price.
Second, the realistic goal is more easy to get other's help.
People cannot achieve their goal without contact anyone, which means people would get help from other people in many times.

If they want to achieve their dream, the realistic one is more easy to get help than the ambitious one, because the realistc one is more easy to let people understand your idea and to do the relatively help.

For example, I and my sister all have the same dream about the art when we are children, I told my I want to become a famous artist and I want to lern how to drawing, so that my mother takes me to the training school to practic painting and always takes me to the gallery to watch the master's painting.
But my sister just tol her mother she want to become the best artist in the world, her mother thought she's joking and not to do anything.
Finally, I am admitted to the Qinghua art school and continue my painting learningï¼Œ but my sister just forget her dream.
To put it into the nutshell.
the realistc go
With the development of the society, it becomes more demanding for people to find their right positions in this society.
Whenever asked about whether the rules that societies today expect young people to follow are too strict, people usually exhibit an air of unccertainty.
Anyway, I don't think the rules that young people are expected to follow today are too strict.
To begin with, the societies now are more free than societies in the past, so the rules that set for young people are more reasonable, which are not too strict.
Today people's attitude toward the world is more open, and they also have learned that everyone should be treated in the same way, no matter what the sex or age of the person is.
So rules for young people and elder people are almost the same.
If the rules for the elder people are no too strcit, then it is not too strict for young people as well.
What's more, societies can understand young people more now, so they will try to think in young people's perspectives.
In this way, the rules young people are expected to follow are not too strict.
Then, young people can be exposed to more rules when they are in school, so they are already used to obey and follow those rule.
Nowadays, young people have learned a lot of rules that they should follow in school and in society.
And they are trained to do so almost everyday.
Take sister's experience as an example.
When my sister studied in shcool, she was asked to wear school uniform everyday, and she could not be late for school as well.
After being asked to do so since she was in primary shcool, she has already formed the habbit to do so.
So she said it's not a big deal to follow such rules, because she is used to them.
Since young people may already be used to the rules they are expected to follow and obey, then those rules are not too strict.

Last but nor the least, I agree that the rules young people are expected to follow and obey nowadays are stricter because the society is becoming better and better, which means there are more demand for young people.
However, I don't think those rules are way too strict, because young people are becoming better and better simultaneously with the society because of the constraint of those rules.
If the rules are too strict to follow then it will have bad effects, but all I can see is positive results.
How can people say rules that lead people to improve themselves are too strict?
To conclude, the rules for young people to follow today are stricter, but they are still posible to obey and may have positive results.
So those rules are not too strict.

he or she does what they beloved and stick to it.

But he has already changed many excellent company because of his extensive talents and hobbies, so he can just pick whatever company he like, while he feels satisfied.
The reason that why he has so many talents and hobbies is that he always do all kinds of part-time jobs, this cultivated him to be a 'multifunctional' person.
So, in order to survive in this complex world satifiedly, we had better to have many different types of tasks to do in the same time as others doing one work.
Moreover, doing work in such way would not allow us to have a sense of bore and we would not be tedious.
I believe all of us should know that if prople only do one simple task for a long time, it is not hard for us to becoome tried or even sleeply osmetimes, and we can easily get to hate the work.
If we could just have many different types of tasks to do in the same time, it could be better for us to be satified and interested in what we are doing.
Above these, we could know why we should do various work in such a time.

Since society grows rapidly with the process of information explotion, the competetion between students are also getting much more severe than ever before, because of which parents tend to use varied ways to encourage thier children to study.
One way, which is quirte contravertial, is that they would offer thier school age children money as a reward every time they manage to get high grade.
From my perspective, I don't agree to this so-called award to stimulate their children's passion of studying.
My reasons are as follows.
First and foremost, money, as a rewarding, is not appropriate for the shape of children's value, especially when they are still in youth.
We want to encourage children to study hard, not just for the reason that we want them to find a better job and lead a better life in the future, matierally speaking.
What's more important is that we want them to stay curious and passionate for this world and always ready to chase for the dream they are desperately in want of.
And if money become a reward for high mark, it will make them feel that money is the very thing that they are in chase of, who will no longer persue the dream they truely love.
Whats more, this reward may cultivate their bad study habbit.
If they know that they will get money as long as they get a good grade, they might just do whatever they can for a high grade.
To think deeply seems to be an unnecessary thing.
As far as I am concerned, there are a lot of subjects I learned at school were not that tough to get a high mark if you worked hard enough to understand what the teacher taught in the class.
But as is widely acknoledged, we also need to cultivate a habit of critical thinking as we study, which will not be inspired by this kind of reward.
To draw a conclusion, despite the fact that money can indeed spur children work hard to get a high grade, it's not beneficial both to their value and to the cultivation of thier cri
With the development of science in current society, people nowadays are able to keep in touch with their friends and stay connected during their work, no longer being afraid of missing out.
Thus it results in that our daily lives are surrounded by information we need to deal with.
Some people may agree that we shouldn't worry about our schedual since parents at home or superiors at work will help us to arrange our time reasonably.
However, I think it improtant for ourselves to obtian the ability to plan and organize.
Firstly, young people today usually have much confidence in themselves so they may prefer to orgnaize their lives on their own.

Since there they are familiar with applications stalled in the cell phone, they can take advantage of it in order to arrange their  What's morever, as it's mentioned in the question, modern life has become more and more complex.
If young people don't have the ability to arrange their time, they will find hard to compete with others.
For example, my brother was used to rely on his parents to plan things for him.
After he graguated from high school, he went to another city for further education.
But, when he started his life in university, he met many obstcles such as being late for the class or forgetting the club activity ect.
Those wouldn't be problems with his parents accompany.
So eventually it made him to realize that he should change and become capable to make his own schedual.
Finally, if one has difficuties to arrange their time, he can also turn to teachers or parents for aid.
Since elder people have been equipped themselves with a lot of experiences on how to make plans or organize their lives, they can provide him accurate opinions on time-table.
Morever, they may guide him in person by showing their life schedual to them.
As an old sayiing goes , " No one makes perfect", and every one is possible to make countless mistakes during their whole life, especially the children.
Thus, I strongly advocate that parents should allow their chirdren make mistakes and learn a lesson from those mistakes.
To begin with, mistakes can enable children to be more experienced.
as we all know, practice makes perfect, only by suffering tones of mistakes can make children learn a lesson from their failure and become more skillful.
To illustrateb this, I would like to take my own experience as example: When I was a child , I usually help my mother washing dishes after meal, most of the time I often broke the bowl.
My mother always encouraged me to learn a lesson from it and never blamed me.
Day by day, I become more and more skillful and never break any bowls or dishes again.
What is more, children as they are, their hearts are soft anfd easy-hurt.
As a result, we cannot emphasize the significance of praise and encouragement too much.
Like a young boy, while learning how to ride a bike, breaking the chains suddenly.
Suppose at this time, his parents blame him for his negligence instead of comfort him, extreme depression will soon fill up the boy's heart.
The next time when he sees a bike, in all probably, he may retreat from it, resulting from his annoyed parents.
Plus, some mistakes, anyway, are ranging from lying to fighting even robbing should be avoid, owing to that they might make the situation leads to worse,.
Permitting the mistakes occurence without violating basic regulations is what we are supposed to do.
In conclution, parents should allow children to make mistakes within moral principles, for the reason either for their innocence and fragility.
Recently, a controvesial topic has aroused a heated debate among people: whether young people nowadays are more likely to spend time and efforts in improving the world than young people in the past?
Opinion vary from person to person.
Some people claim that they think so.
However, I would satnd on their opposite side and I believe that young people today are less likely to spend their time or efforts in improving the world than young people in the past.
My viewpoint can be elaborated as follow.
First, young people today are more concentrated on their own development than young people in the past.
Nowadays, the pressure of competition become bigger and bigger, the society require young people have enough ability to adapt.
As a result, young people today will be more focus on their own development becasue once they do not focus on their own development of life, they would be easily ignored.
As for young people in the past, they have enough time and energy to improve the world because they do not need to face the competitive society and do not have such high pressure.
For example, when I was in high school, I needed to spend at least one third of a day in school.
After school, I also had to took part in the math courses.
I felt so nervous and tired that I had no more patience to think about improving the world.
However,  in the past, young people have more time because they have less pressure from society.
So they will have more energy to build their homeland and peotect it.
Second, the environment that young people live is more peaceful than young people live in the past.
Today the world is full of peace and the people from every country are very friendly.
However, the wars spread out the every corner of the world in the past.
For example, China today is built very well and young people who live in China are very safe and don't need to think about the problem of improving the world.
However, during the 1940s there were thousands of young people in China joined in the army to protect their homeland from Japan.
All in all, I firmly think young people today are less likely to spend their wom time or efforts in improving the world than young people in the past.
Living in such a booming information age, we must be prepared for constantly an army of news floating towards us.

And there occurs a debate whether governments should put emphasis on internent or public transportation improveent, both deserves high attention, but there is only one choice, I will, from where I stand, pick the internet access at the primal place.
And I will voice several reasons below.

Firstly, now that the wifi recovers almost every corner of the world where people exists as well as computer and various medias spring up like the mushrooms, having access to the internet is just a piece of work, and thus developing into an essense in our daily life.
Everyone would spend some time indulging themselves into this rich, mysterious world, escaping from the endless paper or extremely heavy work pressure and relaxing themselves.

Secondly, with the aid of internet, people can view whatever they want and know a wide range of interesting or international news without going out, which contributes to their keeping pace with the fast-pace society, broadening their horizon and avoiding isolation,which may lead to depression.

Thirdly, no doubt the future trend is now toughly dominated by the internet, meetings, ways pf education like homeschooling, even wars will all conducted under the operation of the internet, which also serves as the symbol of the development level of a country.

So, it is if great necessity to boost internet with no effor left, however, that doesn't mean the halt of the public transportaion, all we see and learn on the internet, should be applied to the reality, the public transportation lays the solid foundation for our practice.

And travelling, hiking, socilaizing are all based on the public transportation, if we live in a world with rich internet source but limited traffic access, then a large amount of the wealth we recieved from the internet will be useless because it is hard to apply without a complete transportation system.
In a netshell, internet canbe the primary one deserving deeper development than the public transportation, which, to some extent, will lift our living standard and eyesight significantly.
How meaningful and important it is!
Nowadays, more and more famlies have only one child,which leads to the phenomenon of spliting children.
At the same time, the expactation on children being successful becomes increasingly desperate.
Many parents can not accept any mistake made by their children.

however, I agree with the oponion that parents should let children make mistakes and let them learn from their own mistakes, which not only benefits children them selves, but also contribute to the development of the whole society.
First of all, letting children make mistakes and learning from them is a necessary process of their whole life.
As the saying goes, "if a boy never did anything wrong, he would never  be a man."
For instance, when i was a child, my mother always let me complete school tasks by myself.
While my classmates' parents check their assingment carefully, my mother seemed like not care about that.
As a result , my classmates always did a good job and got compliment from teachers, while i had to be criticized and corrected the mistakes again and again by myself.

Recently, an interesting topic has aroused a heated debate among public: whether being creative rather than planning carefully will solve a problem.
The answer vary from person to person.
Some people support that planning carefully makes the best solution.
However, I stand on the opposit position and I believe that being creative can make solve problems possible.
Firstly, in the business field being creative is helpful to come up a new product which can move our society forward.
As we know, once a new product is produced by a company on the market, in a short time other companies always copy the product or create resemble products.
In this case, the market would be fulfilled with many products with same function, which makes cosumers feel boring and our society can not move on.
Only when a totally new product is come up to the market, buyers are more likely to be caught attention and the new product may change our idea and move our society forward.
For example, before smart phone being come up, the phone market is full of the phone with blunt keyboard.
The creater of smart phone, Jobs, found these phones were too inconvienent and he put forward a novel phone that does not have keyboard and much lighter than before.
Therefore, without the new idea fromJobs, we cannot have simple and convienent life today.
Furthermore, in a acdamic compeition, a creative idea makes win the prize possible.
This is because many participaters would search for the idea that has already win the compeition and they imitate these idea in order to win.
However, the professors who are charge for the compeition are willing to see some new idea rather than the old ones.
Therefore, the creative concept tend to catch professor attention and win the prize.
For example, last year I took participate in  competition that dedicate to find way to save energy.
Most teams conducted their project from the perspecitve that how to save fuel in the car.
However, our team decided to deal with whether other material can replace fuel in the car.
Eventually, our team winned the first prize because of the creative idea.

Could you believe that currently our elders are still crazily enjoying celebrities's concerts of their own age at the moment?
or Could you believe that our elders still are interested in athelets performances on weekends?

Well, it is normal to see famous entertainers and athletes like Guoli Zhang, one of the famous actors in past decades or Yuan Wang, popular boy band idol, are popular and influential among both young people and old people regardless of the age limit.
Hence in my opinion, the opinions of celebrities are of same weight of importance for both younger people and older people.
Admittedly, people may claim that older people are more mature than younger people, in regard to have grown their individual ways towards life, and thus are less affected by celebrityies' opinions.
However, maturity are not necessarily only reason that older people will consider when talking about the opinions of celebrities.
As long as what their celebrities say are reasonable, those opinions could also modify people's traditional attitude towards certain aspects like education or civilization.
Guoli Zhang would serve as an good example to explain this.
Guoli Zhang is one of the out-dated popular actors and the current popular producer of a popular TV program which aims to help younger generation to get married with both young and old audiences.
What he has said on TV, especially those opinions on how to get a successful marriage and how to be an ideal partner, is popular and serves as great role models for both younger and older citizens.
Lots of them use Guoli Zhang's opinions as golden roles when find ideal partners for themselves as well as the next generation.
Hence, it is understandable that opinions of celebrities, especially those with mainstream values, are respected by both the young and the elders.
Another example is Dan Lin, one of the celebrity champions in history.
His words encourages young and old and unites them together.
To conclude, the opinions of celebrities can boost understanding and smooth the relationship between the young people and older people.
As long as young people and old people have celebrity idols in common, conflicts might arouse especially for those who living together.
Currently, generation gap has become a typical social phenomenon with the mass urbanization.
Less young people are willing to initiatively talk with the elders.
Thanks to the mass media, it allows those two groups share similar admirable celebrities, being easier for mutual understanding between them.

The prompt above suggests that, insteading of counting heavily on their parents to make decisions regarding their own lives, young people would be better off, should they are able to make their own choices concerning their own lives.
From my perspective, this is a proposition that I tend to side myself with and my reasons are as follows.
For one thing, the first step of learning to be the master of one's own fortune begins with being able to make one's own decisions.

It is true that parents could help their children throughout the lives of their children, but what needs to be emphasized is the fact that, as time passes, these children must be on their own  when it comes to matters in their own lives in order for them to become adult themselves.
Out of the love for PC softward, Bill Gates dropped out Harvard, against their parents' will and started Microsoft with other dreamrunners like him.
After years of arduous efforts, the operating system Windows was out and, since then, the Microsoft empire has been one of the most successful companies the world has ever witnessed.
Had  Gates relied heavily on his parents in the decisionmaking of dropping out Harvard, the world would more than likely fail to see the rise of Microsoft.

For another, gaining the opportunity of having the final say in one's own decision-making would also require the young people to be as informative as he or she could, and, among all the possible information that he or she needs, adivce offered by their parents should hold a place.
It is evident that, by getting oneself immmersed in the advice of parents, children might be overwhelmed or, worse, get themslved exasperated.
However, the guidance or the suggestions that parents offer could also be of some help.
The late deceased billionaire Rockefeller had offered quite a lot to not only his children but also millions of young people regarding how they could increase the chance of embracing a better future.
While not all of those who listened and followed his advice become as successful as he is, it is more than clear-cutting that many young people would be worse off should they not follow his adivce.
In a nutshell, it is truly paramount and hence indispensable for young people to be the master of his or her choices concering issues in their own lives.
In the process of making such a choice,however, it is also crucial for him or her to be openminded and try to regurgitate their parents' advice.

In this day and age, Internet plays a vital role in everyday situations, so this is absolutely necessary to improve Internet access.
However, as an indispensable part in any sphere of life, public transportation is also in great need to have improvement.
From my point of view, it is more crucial to improve the latter one than the former one.
My opinion will be amplified by the following reasons.
First and foremost, improvements on public transportation allows less accidents.
This is mainly because people will no longer drive or ride an motorcycle to work, thus leading to the decrease in accidents.
A salient example of this can be seen in my friend's experience.
He walked to school every day and there was a roud without traffic lights just in front of his community.
Every day it was dangerous for him to walk through since in China the automobiles would not let the passengers go first, which was easy to get hurt.
One day, there was a motorcycle clashing into him.
He was hurt but he told no one.
Finally when he got home, he told his parents that he felf painful.
It was until then did his parents know the accident.
As the instance reveals, if more poeple go to work or school by public transportation, there will be less people getting injured.
In addition, it provides great benefits to the enviroment.
This is largely due to the fact that less people drive the car, thus the exhaust gas from the car reducing.
As a result, the enviroment in this area will be perfected in a large scale.
For example, the time for people in a specific city to drive the cars are strictly restricted.
If the last number of their car plate is an odd, they cannot drive the car the the day when the date is even.
With this limit, the time people drive decreases.
So the air in that city is fresher than the other one in this country and the river is much cleaner.
People are even allowed to see the blue sky and beautiful birds on the tree.
As this example demonstrates, improvements on the public transportation can lead to decrease in drive and hence a better enviroment.
It is true, to some extent, that almost all people rely on Internet access.
However, people can use a smart phone with more available data and stop using it for their eyes when there is no Interenet connection.
Consequently, due to the benefits listed above, it is more crucial to improve public transportation than Internet access.
Nowadays, there are some claims that university should pay more for professors to improve the quality of education.
Admittedly, educational quality in normal universities face so many problems such as imbalanced resources, spliting between students and professors and unjustified examination.
However, all of these problems can not be solved by spending more money on salaries for professors.
As far as I am concered, universities can solve these by purchasing for better educatinal resources and increasing the communication between students and professors.
Firstly, the most crutial problem of educational quality lies in imbalanced resources.
As we all know that better universities gain lot of sponsors from government or individuals.
With plenty of sponsors, they can not only update better equipment for teaching but also purchase various library resources like journals and professional textbooks.
All of these contribute to cultivate elite in universities.
However, most of universities are normal to gain huge sponsors.
In such condition, what they should do is make full use of their money to relieve the difference in resources.
What's more, another severe problem lies in the gap between professors and students.
Lack of knowlegeable and emotional communication between them cause many problems.
In the class, professors just talk about what they want to talk and they do not desire to discuss with student.
In the condition, students lose their interests to gain more knowledge from asking professors.
These lead to educatinal quality decrease.
Universities can hold some lecture or parties to relieve such problems.
In parties, they can comm
To sum, better educational resources which contain updating teaching equipments and various library resources can provede better enviroment to studying.
Also, deep communication between students and professors can eliminate gaps between them.
All of these are more beneficial to improve the qualitie than just increase professors' salaries.
Travel is a good way for people to relax in their spare time.
Different peole have divided opinion on their journeies' destination.
Some people prefer to travel abroad, while as far as I am concerned, having trips in our own country is more beneficial for us.
My reasons and examples for this point are listed as follows.
First and foremost, travelling in our own country enables us to save time, which is pretty favourable for us.
That is because it can avoid us to waste too much time on our route, which wil not interfere with our daily work.
One the contrary, if we travel abroad, we have spend much more time on the trip due to the distance.
My own experience can be a salient example for this point.
I am a postguate, and due to my heavy tasks in my laboratory, it is impossible for me to possess enough spare time to travel for a long distance, let along visit foreign countries.
Thus, in my vacation, I prefer just go to several tourist spots near my citiy with my best friends to relieve my pressure.
Moreover, travelling domesticately render us a good chance to know our own culture.

That is because during our trips, those well-know tourist attracitons in our country will trigger us to explore the historcial stories behind them, which is a precious opportunity for us to gain the mastery of our country's history.
I have a case to aptly illustrate my point.
Last summer vacation, I visisted the Great Wall in Beijing, and was shocked by its specular archetecture style.
Thus, I asked my tour guide about its function and origin.
He told me that this building was used to defend the nomatic races living in the north of ancient China.

After tring my suggestion, he said that he was more relaxed and he could work out a big problem in maths which he never did it before.

Somebody says that young people doesn't need to have the ability to plan and organize.

That is because their parents cannot always take care of them, and the ability to plan and organize can affect their acdemic success.

Secondly, the ability to plan and organize can affect their acdemic success.

I still remember that the year before last year I saw some news on the newspaper about a student who got an A plus in every subject dropped out from Qinghua University just because he did not have the ability to plan and organize!
What a shame!
To sum up, their parents cannot always take care of them, and this ability can affect your acdemic success.
As a result, it is extremely important for young people to have the ability to plan and organize.
I hope all the parents knows this and will teach ther children this ability, this will be good for them in the future.

To begin with, it is the lesson parents teached to their kids.
The rule of adult world is imposing on you to be a competitive person, and the competition already begins at the early stage.
The higher   grades they get, the more pocket cash they received, and the stronger purchase power they have.
Similar to the basis that the better performance you accomplished, the higher bonus you get, children learn the simple theory through this vividly adapted approach.
Also, it encourages children to improve their study method.
For instance, if Sam did bad in the last exam and wanted to change the situation in the forecoming test, what he had to do was to reflect on what he did.
Was it something wrong?
How should I do to make things little better?
Did I neglect or overstress the certain steps?
Or were these lead to the inefficiency or depression that prevent me to do better?
With all these thoughts and  assumed solutions he began the newly attempt to improve himself, which is definitely the excellent circulation to refresh oneself.
Moreover, the experience children learned from this system of learning and rewarding and reflecting will contribute to the later working career.
Some may argue that study isn't the whole thing of children and what they should to is to broaden their horizon and develop comprenhensively.
However, the ways children adopted in study also function in many other walks of life.
He or she may know the effective way of time management and self control.
Or he may be familar to the ways to ask for their peers and teachers.
Even he get used to the easy way to quickly learn the new concepts which may well-fit nowadays keep-updating enviorment.
All these will make them a valued person with basic competitive skills.
Money given to children shall link to the real world and teach them a lesson,which is exactly his way.

Recently, an interesting topic has aroused a heated debate: which ability is more important: ability of making new friends or the one of maintainning friends.
The answer varies from person to person.
From my perspective, I believe that the ability of maintaining friendship is more important and people can become more happy.
To  begin with, ability of maintaining friendship is conducive to learning other's advantage and friends tend to be closer.
As we know, maintianing relationship always take a long time to kown each othe better.
As the deeper we know, every member in a small group are more likely to emerge their own upside and downside.
For the upside of the friends, we can absord it, while for the downside of them, it does not hurt to remind them to correct, which is also consolidate our friendship.
For example, I met a group of friends in a basketball team by playing together and later we exchanged our telephone number.
As we chated in a group everyday, we found each person is attractive and they all had some advantages.
I learned the sense of humor from one person and I was correct a mistake of careless by others.
Eventually, we become best friends and always travel together in a holidy.
Furthermore, maintaining friendship is helpful to save a lot of time on making new friends.

This is because facing some people everyday we know other's quality and charateristic so we will avoid the topic of chatting, such as favorite food, favorite film, which allow us to try some new topics.
On  the contrary, each time we make friends we always start to talk basic topics to know them superficially.
If we save these time of talking boring things, we spend more time on dealing with something together with friends, which would be the precious memory for the friendship.
To illustrate, when I chat with my friends I will continue our topic that ended last time.
So our relationship is moving on all the time.
Last week we decided to travel to Beijing next holiday and I am looking forward to this trip.
To sum up, It is advisable that the ability of maintainning friendship is more important than ability of making new friends.
Nowadys, more and more people feel sressuful in their job, all of them need a high efficiency to relax themselves.
So there are two agurements in front of them.
One of them choose relax by watching and read, and the other of them are willing to do physical exercise.
I agree with the first point, because I think when you have been stressful and tired,you need to relax your body ,I think it is the most aviliable way to relax.
From my standpoint of view,relaxing by watching a movie and reading books is a mild way.
As we know, when a people   feel back breaking, the most of them just want to go to the bed,and sleep for a long time.
Why they want to do that?
Because their bodies feel too tired, so the capacity in their bodies can't support their work.
You can imagine that if you have been tired but you chosed to relax by doing physical, you must feel more back breaking.
So I think the first point is better.
Furthermore,I think watching a movie or reading a book is relax your brian.

For example, many times, the fatigue is not come from your body, they might come from your brain ,is is a mentally tired,  so at this time, you relax by doing physical exercise is a low level efficiency.
Adversly, you need to watchi a movie and read a book,they can decrease the stress faster than doing physical.
That's why I support the first point.
Finally, when you reading a book or watching a movie, they can attract your atterntion, when you pay attention on other things, you might not take care of your fatigue.
For example, when you are tired, you will drink a coffee and do something else,that a typical example of the point, because the work attract your attention so that you won't be much tired.
To sum up, the first way is a way which is higher level efficiency and all-sided, because it could help you to relax from many aspects,your mentally tired and it can attract your attention.
So,from the all responds above, I agree with the first point.
In our daily lives, mistakes seem to be unavoid while working or study which may be result from the exhausted power or losing concentration.
However, making mistakes and learning from them for children should be allowed by parents have bben debated.
As far as I am concerned, parents should allow their kids to do this.
To begin with, making mistakes and learning from it is an effective way to progress.
Since after you making mistakes, you may be punished or pay the price for their actions.
It will leave a deep impression in their mind and thy will not do this next time.
Take my experience for example, in my final examination, I forgot an important equation and performed bad in the math examination.
Therefore, I was not able to get the prize from the teacher.
After that, I never forgot this equation.
Second, it is helpful to to the children's development of the personality.
Because if the parents do not allow their kids to make any mistakes and learn from it or even punish thei kids.
The kids may be afraid of making mistakes and even try their best to conceal their mistakes in order to avoid punishment.
If things continue like this way, they will be unwilling to communicate with the parents due to the threaten from the parents.
It may cause the mental problem that will even influence their relationship with other people.
In order to let the kids grow healthily, parents should let their kid make mistakes.
If the parents do not allow their kid to make mistakes, it really can make the kids to be careful.

My math teacher said that he always asked his kid to be careful while doing math questions and after longtime, his kid really always get full marks in the examination because of  his cautious that developed in his daily life.
However, it is good for developing a good habit, it still have harm to the kids to grow up.
To sum up, I strongly agree parents to allow their kid make and learn from mistakes.

And this is the real rilable and remarkable way to let children learn lessons from their fault.

Nowadays, there is an interesting topic around us, should government improve the safety by hiring more police or improve the old buildings and streets to attract more tourists?
It is true that different people have various opinions towards the same thing.
Actually, as far as I am concerned, I agree with this idea and my point of view is supported by the following reasons.
First of all, safety is always the first place to be taken into consideration when people decide to go to another places during the period of their vacation.
Tourists will be worried about the safety money and ourselves when go to an unsafe place, thus would be likely to have no good mood to appreciate the fantastic secens or local traditional culture.

However, thing is different when safety is guaranteed such as hiring more police, it will give tourists a pyscological suggestion and they are going to enjoy their vacation with their families or friends without any worries.

Take my example for an example, last summer vacation I went to Brusty with my parents, there were not enough police and local people, although the natural scenery was beautiful, such as the colorful flowers and green trees, however, we had no mood to appreciate them because we felt horrible from the bottom of our heart as there were no people around as.
Besides, improving the appearance by improving the old buildings and streets can boost the local economy to some degree because more and more people would choose there for vacation.

Imaging that there are some old buildings in a traditional Chinese style alongside the street, the houses are made of white and black materials, there are few people walking along the street, people will feel a kind of tranquil beauty.
It is also easier for them to get release of daily pressure and relax themselves from this special experience when walking on the old streets.
Actually,  more and more people will come here and thus increasing more job opportunities for the local people.
In other words, the government can make profit from this process and the local economy will be improved to some degree.
To sum up, I hold the belief that it is important for the government to improve safety and the appearance in order to attract more tourists.

The education of our next generation is a hot debated field.
Peers and teachers play a indispensable role in our school life.
Some people believe that students are more influenced by their teachers than by their friends.
However, as for me, I think the peers of me will contribute more impact to shape my personality than teachers do.
Not only because we live together so we have more attachment, but also it will be easier for us to learn something form the opponents.
First of all, compared to the teachers, we have more interaction with our peers, by which we can observe and learn from  them from lots of different perspects.

Everybody will have this kinds of experence, you spend 10 hours in school, and there are only 1 or 2 hours for you to working with your teacher, while maybe you spend all these hours on working with your classmates.
So, absolutely we can learn and observe them from all the aspect like playing together, stadying togerther or even falling in lovewith each other.

Some contend that parents should not offer money for high grade thier children get, while I believe it is feasible for parents to do so because the bonus could help motivate the children and it can teach childredn to arrange their own economic plans.
To begin with, the money offeed by parents for the high grade can be a very good incentive to motivate children.
On most occasions, children study hard in order to obtain the recognition from their parents rather than for themselves.
Hence the bonus can serve as a kind of compliment for children's work and motivate them to study even harder.
Take myself as a example, when I was in 3rd grade in primary school, I did really poor in English.
Before the final exam of that term, my mom promised that I would get a 100 yuan bonus if I could improve my English grade.
So I studied hard because I wanted my mom to think that his son was a useless bad student.
Then it turned out that Imade it and got my bonus, therefore I believe the bonus can be really effective motivation.
Moreover, the bonus can also teach children how to deal with their owm money and make good economic plans.
After a child get the money for a good grade, he has many alternatives, such as buying a new book or new a new bike, or just donate the money to those in need.
No matter how he decided to spend the money, the process of making decision helps develop a good habit of planing and a sense of responsibility for one's own wealth.
As a student majored in finance, I have once read a paper based on this topic and the thoery of behavioral finance.
The conclusion of the paper is that people who had control of their own  money in thier childhood are more prone to make more money in the future.
So the bonus for high grade is aslo helpful in teaching children to make plans of their own money.
Some people may say that giving children too much money can cause thier abuse of money, while I think this problem is excatly how my second opinion could work to help solve.

Recently, a topic that is closely related to dreams and reality has aroused a heated debate: should people always follow their dreams even if the dreams are ambitious, or focus on achieving their realistic goals?
In my opinion, I definitely support that people should focus on their realistic aims.
To begin with, achiving realistic goals can help people realize the sense of contentment.
Everyone has their own goals, such as buying a big house, and marrying a good person.
They will make great efforts to realize their goals, and then they will be able to live happy life.
Just as the saying goes, "contentment is happiness", people will feel happy when their goals are achieved.
For example, my uncle is working in Beijing, and all he wanted was buying a house in Beijing.
He worked very hard for ten years, and he promoted very fast in his company.
As a result, he earned enough money to buy a 150-square-meter house near the center of Beijing.
Now, he is satisfied with his life and
Moreover, achiving realistic goals can bring people sense of accomplishment.
When people have remote dreams to reach, they will always work hard on them.
They may face a lot of difficulties to approach their dreams, and they will experience failures many times, which may strike their confidence.
However, realistic goals is relatively easy to achieve compared with ambitious dreams.
When the realistic aims are reached, people will get sense of accoplishment which will motivate them to do more things and set a further goal.
For instance, I usually set a goal for myself, such as getting a good score on my exam, or reading a good book in two days.
When I reach my goal, I will get a sense of success because I have learned a lot from it.

In my opinion, telling the truth is not alway the most important consideration in any relation ship between people.
Some time the lies can encourage people, then improve the relationship and truth will broke the relationship and cause some predictable conflict.
Sometime telling the truth is nessesary, telling the shortage and disadvantage about each other can be mutual benefit.
Firstly, sometime the lies is nessesary in a relationship.
The kind lies can encourage people and improve the relationship.
This kind of lies can make your friend more confidence and feel better, when he realize this is not true but he can understand you.
For example, someone is having  cancer and  going to die.
In this situation, his friend tell him the cancer can be heal by eating apple.
We know that is not true, but that will give a hint to the patient, he has opportunity to live, so he will not give up.
This lie give the patient confidence and encourage him to live.
Secondly , sometime the truth will broke the relationship and cause some conflicts.
The truth is not always good, some time people prefer listening the lies rather than truth.
For example, in a birthday party, your friend give a gift to you.
Maybe the gift is not your dishes, but if you tell him the gift is bad, your friends think that is offend, then  relationship will be damaged, and will cause the argue between you and your friend.
This problem is not about principle, use kind lie will not damage the relationship
Beside that, sometime the truth is important in a relationship.
Telling the shortage an disadvantage about each other can be multibenefit.
For example, the father find his son steal the needdles form other family.
If he did not tell his son the truth, stealing is a illegle thing, his son will think the stealing is not a big deal then continue to steal.
In this situation , truth can be benifit to other.
In concusion,sometime we need to tell the truth, some time we need to lie, it dependent on the situation.
Therefore telling the truth is not fit all situation in any relationship

Nowadays, as the step of society goes faster, there is a hot debate whether cooking and preparing foods costs less time in twenty years than it does today.
After all, the technoloy is very advanced today, and it will be more advanced in twenty years.
When you make an order on Internet, you can get what you want to eat in three minutes in China.
However, in my opinion, people in twenty years are willing to take time to cook and prepare foods for these reasons.
Firsty, the awareness of healthy life will be improved in twenty years.
This is because nowadays the young who are about twenty have begun to study healthy manus to stay wholesome, while our grandparents just considered how to survive in their young age.
Many young people began to pay attention to high quality of life and they have grown up in well-off family.
In this case, they don't worry about how to fill with their stomach.
In twenty years, when the young become parents, they will care for their children's health.
Consequently, they will spend more time to think about the manus they offer to the kids to ensure the nutritions in meals.
On the contrary, the old idea that we just need sufficient foods will have gone in twenty years.
For example, my cousin works as a wateress in a resturant.
Even thogh she always feels tired and exhausted after a whole days' work, she still selects materials of cooking carefully, and prepares them thoroughly.
As a result, I believe in twenty years, when she is forty-four years old, she will still maintain the awareness of health and enhance this idea to her kids.
So if the cognition to stay healthy can be improved, people will take more time in cooking and preparing foods.
Secondly, the knowledge of nutritions will be widespreaded in twenty years.

This is because educated poeple become more and more, In this case, they will have more elements to take into account, such as the original place where the fruits or vegitable come from, the parts of cattle which is more delicious, and which kinds of foods cannot be cooked together.
On the contrary, people nowadays have less access to these knowledge.
So people in the future will spend more time in preparing materials.

When it comes to an ordinary problem whether we should interupt and correct the mistake of our teachers or meeting leaders right away in the classroom or in the meeting, different people hold distinctive views about it.

Some agrees that we should correct it immediately to ensure everything goes on well while others may think it is better to wait until the calss or meeting is ober and the people are gone, and then talk to the teacher or meeting leader about the mistake.
Even someone prefers to sating nothing.
From my perspective, I am for the second resolution.
First, the teacher or the meeting leader may feel awkward to be interrupted in front of so many people.
Showing respect to the lecturers who thrived to make the lecture rich, meaningful and articulate is really important and necessary.

If we stand on their shoes, imagining that we are the one standing on the stage to give a  speech, in which most of the words should be recited in advance, and the errors should be aboided as much as possible.
How stressed the lectuter is!
Therefore, it is totally a bad idea to put up the problem directly to make the lecturer feel guilty and nervous.
We should just write down what we want to correct, and keep silence for a minute to encourage the lecturer finish the whole lecture in his mind.
Second, raising hand and sharply pointing out the mistake can not only interfere the teacher or the meeting leader, but also will distract the audiences by arousing their attention.

Audience would be goning to focus on the wrong thing disussed by the lecturer rather than the main point that he indeed wants to convey, which is a shame and not fair to all the ones who concentarated on the speech before.

Hence, I insist that we should not instantly have the highlight on ourselves to show off that we are clever enough to find the mistake of others, instead, to show trust on others and believe that all others are also reflectiong on their questions about the lecture and do not disturb them.

Third, holding the question as well as waiting for later discussion may contribute to a superb opportunity to have a deeper and futher vonversation wuth extraordinaty leader or experienced and expert teacher without anyone distraction or time limited, either, since the class or the meeting has expored.
There does exist the chance taht we had a wrong jufgment about whether the lecturer made a mistake for the lack of time fiven into thinking in the lecture.

To conclude, the second choice makes both the lecturer and the auduences comfortable and being respected, and also give ourselves a chane to have s second thought, which is the reason why I high recommend everyone to take this choice when they are in this situation.
In my opinion, this statement can actually has two sodes to discuss.
Firstly, sometimes parents can't let children to make mistakes , since the word "mistakes " dosen't  represent  a  clear meaning.

as an example, the child broke the window of the house, when he's playing soccer,  parents rebuke him even the child had apologied and the child gets upset about  that.
In this way, children may feel unfair that parents even never understand them, as a result, the relationship between children and parents might  froze al llittle.
In a word, if the mistakes didn't affect childrens' personnality and life , there's no need to force them to learn a lesson , just let children  go , they will find out their mistakes as time goes.
Secendly, if the mistakes turn to be serious that affect childrens' life  and if  the  mistakes is not corrected right awy , there will happen a really serious result.

I f the parents don't get to know the reson then the child will keep stealing for that reson.

In conclusion, whether parents should let children make mistakes and let them learn from their own mistakes depends on how serious or heavy the "mistakees" are ,if not serious, they willget to know that as time passes by , parents don't have to break their relationships ; if the "mistakes' are heavy , parents should take action or children will not learn from their own mistakes until next heavier mistakes.
Nowadays, there is a popular awarding policy among parents and their school-age children, which is the kids can get awarding money for each high grade they get in school.
Different people hold different opinions on it.
Some people think it's good for motivation, but some think it does harm to children's growth because they are actually supressed to study hard, which is not voluntarily.
As for me, I think it will be a great idea only if parents run the awarding system in the right way.
On the one hand, children will become more hard-working if they know they can get some awards as soon as they get good grades in schools.
It is common that there is always something which kids want to buy but can't realize because of the lack of pocket money.
Therefore, the excess awarding money will become a great motivation for them.
They are more willing to concentrate on the class and finish the homework on time to get the better grades, and then to buy their dream present by their own.

On the other hand, to some extent, this kind of awarding policy will give the kids some wrong assumptions about studying because it seems as they are just studying for money and for their favorate gifts.
Therefore, it is not difficult to image that once they get enough pocket money to buy all the things they want, they will stop studying hard then.
That's why choosing a right way to offer award money is so crucial.
As far as I am concerned, parents should set a serious of detailed standards to make the awarding system more realizable.
More imporotant, the system should be based on the progress their kids make compared to the formal semester rather than the certain grades they get in the current semester.
For example, it will be more wisdom in this: one dollar for every five more scores you get compares to the last examination.
This kind of standard can always provide the children best motivations and keep them concentrate on studying all the time.
In short, there is no doubt that offering school-age children money for each high grade they get in school is a good way to motivate kids.
However, its result is depends on the right methods and standards parents used.
In my opinion, offer school-age children money for their high score is not a good idea.
First, school-age children are still on their way to observe the world and learn from it.
They do not have stable point of view to the world.
They are easily influenced by people around them, for instance, their parents.
Appreciating children for their high mark by giving them money could probably lead them to consider that their good behavior should always be reward, which is not true.

Then if one day, these children grow up, they have to fight for their own living, and nobody has the responsibility to offer award for their hardworking on their own lives, they might get hurt or loose confidence.
Not to consider the children's future, the school life could also hard for them.
They would study for their parents' money, not for learning knowledge.
Maybe school-age children do need some award for their outstanding performance at school to encourage them keeping up their good work, however, offering money is not a good option.
Most school-age children do not have ability that is strong enough for them to spend the money appropriately.
When I was in primary school, my deskmate had the problem to use and control his award money.
Once he got a 90 on his science test, his parents gave him 50 RMBs.
When I went back to my seat, I found a grasshopper on my desk.
My deskmate told me he bought it from another student using all of the 50 RMBs.
I was quite shocked at the time I knew this.
This kind of examples are actually pretty common among the school-age children.
In short, Ioffer school-age children money for their high score is not a good idea.
Do you remember the last time when your family members help you with the difficulties you met and encourage you to be more hard-working?
Many people hold the point of view that the help from one's family is essential to one's life.
From my perspective, I'm persuaded that this kind of help made a person to be more likely to success nowadays because it's more powerful and more frequent when compared to the past.
Firstly, parents show more consideration on their children's education.
Do you remember the angry expressions on your parents' faces when they knew that you got a low score from the examination?
It's common sense that parents are being much more concerned about their children's score in school.
However, this kind of situation was rarely happened to your parents.
In the past, what the parents of your father or mother mostly cared about whether they can support the whole family owing to the low economic level at that time.
They would be satisfied if they can let all the family members have enouth food to eat.
On account of this situation, they would care not that much about the education of their children.
So the different concentration level would result in the different education level, and that would make people nowadays easier to success.
Moreover, family nowadays can provide much stronger help than the past.
With the develpment of the society, the thing that people can do changed a lot.
For example, if your dream is to be a good pilot.
The thing you need to achieve your dream is to accept professional pilot training lesson and fly enough hours in planes.
Let's suppose that you were born in the 1960s, in a middle class family in China.
The most possible situation you would be confronted with when you tell your father that you want to be a pilot is that he scold you to be practical and let you help with the family chores.
Nevertheless, if you were born in the 2000s, still in a middle class family in China.
Your parents may be happy about your dream and send you to a pilot school when you get older.
As the instancde has illustrated, family can provide you with stronger help, and this kind of help can make it much more possible for you to succeed.

As an old saying goes:"There generations cultivate a gentleman."
Success needs accumulation of experience.
People ask whether children should do the similar jobs as their parents.
In my opinion, the tradition of a family is carried on generation by generation.
And the story can be found from different oppucations.
So, it is better for children to choose jobs akin to their parents.
There are at least three aspects of advatage for the similar career choose.
The first aspect is the skills and experience a certain career needs.
If children Parents have stepped ahead for  more than 20s years than the younger generation.
In the begining of the child's career pursuing, he can learn a lot from the familiar teacher and leader--his father or mother.
Once he face some trouble in job or in career-relevant life, he can consult to the teacher whenever he needs.
For instance, I have a high-school classmate, who became a civil servant as his father did.
His father paved the way for his early career and he can settle his professional life as soon as he graduated from university.
How to take part in the tests, how to prepare the interview, all these information and skills he can coached by his father easily.
The second aspect is the accumulaton of the soft skills.
People are not born to be talent.
Some kinds of jobs need generations of accumulation, like doing business.
Business man need negationation wisdom, broaden horizon of eyesights and acute sense of opportunities.
Some famous business man came out from business families.
With generations' experience to distinguish good chance from bad, they can make the cost dowm and hold the risk affordable.
Success become a group job.
Two heads are always better than one.
Even my father has given my a lot of teaching wisdom about how to draw my students' attention.
By the way, share the same interest with my father feels good.
The last aspect is the platform which are warmed by parents.
The chance is so important for a youngster.
Only if there are chances, the successful story can have earth to happen.

Dealing with changable tasks offers people more opptunities to chanllenge themselves and also fullfill their ablities so that to make progress and gain improvements which is of vital impotance to their career life.

With increasing intense competition among the children, their education plays a crucial role in their parents' mind.
Some parents attempt to create some methods to encourage their children to study harder.
Recently, the phenomenon that parents are willing to give some money as a reward to their children for a high grade in the school has caused a wide concern.
Some people critize this method because it could cause a negetive influence on children's growth.
However, I maintain the opposites view that giving some money to children as a reward is a positve choice, compared with its drawbacks.
To start with, giving some money as a reward to their children can stimulate children to study harder.
Certainly, we can't deny that sometimes study is considered a boring and repeated task, such as reading the book, solving math problems, and listening the records.
These feedbacks are able to change children's attitude to study from a boring task to a attractive job, as well as keep a continuing interest of study.
Using these money to buy some gifts they prefer is also attractve for them, isn't it?
In addition, it is necessary for children to establish a healthy attitude to efforts and feedbacks, feedbacks would not come back until substantial efforts have been made.
This concept could benifits children not only at present but also in the future.
For instanse, when they graduate and work in a company, they concentrate on the task itself first, rather than the feedback.
They usually have a better behavior and would obtain more chances of promotion.
Indeed, it is unaceptable to give too much money to children once a time, which would change children's intention of study even make them seek for just one thing, money.
Nevertheless, when we make sure children have established a healthy and completed attitude to money, it will be fine to do so.
Accoding to the reasons explained above, I must highlight my opinion that it is good for parents to give some money as a reward to their children for each high mark in the school.
Nowadays, more and more complaints about the children's education are full with every kinds of mass media.
